Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Oxaliplatin, Capecitabine, and Radiotherapy in Neoadjuvant Treatment for Rectal Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: In this phase I/II trial, patients with T3-4 rectal cancer were enrolled from four centers.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility included histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma within 15 cm of the anal sphincter.

Intervention.evidence: Oxaliplatin was administered on days 1 and 29 with a fixed capecitabine dose of 1000 mg/m² twice daily on days 1–14 and 25–38, alongside 50.4 Gy radiotherapy.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) and efficacy of oxaliplatin combined with capecitabine and radiotherapy (Capox-RT) as neoadjuvant therapy for rectal cancer.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the R0 resection rate, assessed in phase II.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding details were not applicable.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between June 2003 and December 2004, 22 patients were enrolled, with 21 evaluable for outcomes.

Harms.evidence: Grade III diarrhea occurred in 18% of patients.
